trustfund:
TF040017-MEXICO - PROTECTED AREAS,TF036020-MEXICO - NATURAL PROTECTED AREAS,TF028678-GEF1-MEXICO ENVIRONMENTAL
            PROJECT (FMCN)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Protected Areas Program
            Restructuring Project builds on the April/May 1996
            agreements and continues the Government's effort to
            address the weaknesses identified in the 1995 Pronatura
            assessment report. The project's objectives are to: a)
            protect unique biodiversity in eligible biosphere and
            special biosphere reserves; b) strengthen protected areas
            management at the reserve level; c) promote local
            participation in the implementation of protected areas
            operating and management plans; and d) ensure long-term
            recurrent cost financing for core protection and
            conservation activities. The project has the following
            components: 1) Reserve conservation programs will improve
            reserve management and ensure effective biodiversity
            conservation in the 10 project reserves. 2) Central
            coordination program will strengthen project performance at
            the national level, with particular emphasis on protected
            area management, the Technical Advisory Committee mechanism,
            and project evaluation. 3) Permanent endowment for protected
            areas will consist of the establishment and operation of the
            Fondo para Areas Naturales Protegidas for supporting reserve
            conservation and coordination programs benefiting the 10
            project reserves.
